Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian pottery chalice; white slip; exterior: glazed streaky black (fired reddish); two added white bands; underside: trace of white slip, probably accidental; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: White bands appear on the feet of chal;ices of many styles: Mature Animal Style, see Lemos nos. 674 and 676 from Pitane; Grand Style, see Lemos no. 800 from Pitane; Chalice Style, see Lemos no. 938 from Tarentum, no. 952 from Thessaloniki and no. 956 from Istros; Black Figure Komast, see Lemos nos. 1562 and 1564 from Tocra.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0710) (phase 2)
